body.p:
Louisville Ky Octor 1865
To
Hon. Thos. E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Sir

I would respectfully state that on the 13th day September I was fined ($600 x/100) Six hundred dollars -- on an Indictment found against me by the Grand Jury of the City Court of Louisville I would respectfully state that I have paid thereon ($100 x/100) one hundred dollars

I suggest that the sum thus paid is likely sufficient -- I am poor not keeping that character of house called first class; -- a house where wealth is used to gild the immorality and lure the youth into them, and from paths of virtue
I shall obtain the signatures of some of the citizens to join in my prayer for this exercise of the Executive clemency

I shall ever pray &c.
Mary Ryan
We the undersigned citizens of Louisville would respectfully request your Excellency to grant the prayer of the petitioner

Louisville City Ct
vs
Petition for Remission of fine
against
Mary Ryan
for $600,
Remitted 6th Nov 1865
